parts.name: Bearing
parts.description: Reduces friction between moving parts, such as between shafts and wheels.  Bearings come in different sizes, and come in both hex and circular shapes.

parts.name: Belts
parts.description: Belts are a loop of flexible material used to link two or more rotating pulleys.

parts.name: Bolts
parts.description: Bolts are fasteners used to keep two objects in a fixed position.  Bolts come in different lengths and widths.  The widths are designated by the following colors in our naming system: Red, Yellow, Orange.

parts.name: Chain
parts.description: A chain connects to a sprocket to do various work such as spinning shafts, acting as an elevator, etc.  There are two types of chain: #25 and #35.

parts.name: Couplers
parts.description: Couplers connect two shafts together.

parts.name: Gears
parts.description: Mechanisms that mesh together via teeth and are used to transmit motion from one shaft to another.  Gears come with different amounts of 'teeth.'

parts.name: Gearboxes
parts.description: Gearboxes allow mechanisms to move at different speeds and torques with motors.  Higher gear ratio = higher torque and less speed.  Lower gear ratio = lower torque and more speed.

parts.name: Gussets
parts.description: Gussets are plates for connecting aluminum stock together.  They come in many different shapes and sizes, such as T-shaped, L-shaped, angle, corner, etc.  Some also hold bearings as well.  See the product page for more details; it’s good to know all of the different gussets available.

parts.name: Hubs
parts.description: Hubs are used to spin wheels with shafts.

parts.name: Lock collars
parts.description: Lock collars are used to hold objects in place and prevent them from shifting, such as keeping shafts from sliding by out of position.  Make sure not to lose the screw in the lock collar!  The screw is usually a blue screw in our naming system.

parts.name: Motors
parts.description: Motors are used by converting electrical energy into mechanical energy to make shafts spin.  They are usually connected to gearboxes.  Different types of motors include 775 Pro, BAG, CIM, Mini CIM, Neo, Falcon 500, etc.

parts.name: Nuts
parts.description: A nut is a type of fastener with a threaded hole. Nuts are almost always used with a bolt to fasten parts together.

parts.name: Pistons
parts.description: Pistons use air to move a shaft in and out.  Pistons can be used for a variety of things such as lifting something or moving something back and forth.  Pistons are also known as 'Bimbas.'

parts.name: Pulleys
parts.description: Pulleys are used to move objects up and down, or side to side. A system made of belts and pulleys can be used to make elevators.

parts.name: Rivets
parts.description: A light fastener that is commonly used to fasten stock and gussets together.

parts.name: Shafts
parts.description: Shafts are similar to an axle on a car.  You can mount objects on the shaft, such as wheels, spacers, and lock collars.  The two most common types of shafts are hex and circular.

parts.name: Spacers
parts.description: Spacers are useful for spacing out items on a shaft, such as gears and wheels.

parts.name: Sprockets
parts.description: A sprocket is a wheel with teeth that meshes with a chain to make it spin.  The sprocket is placed on a shaft in order to make it spin.  There are two types of sprockets: #25 and #35.

parts.name: Stock
parts.description: A piece of aluminum that is used as the frame of the robot and comes in different sizes, which conveniently comes with holes pre drilled.  Stock comes in 1x1, 2x1, flat stock, l-stock, etc.

parts.name: VersaBlock/Bearing block
parts.description: A bearing mount that goes around VEX stock to hold bearings.  This is commonly used for the drivetrain.

parts.name: Wheels
parts.description: Wheels are used to move the robot and can also be used to intake or outtake an object.  Examples of wheels are omni, traction, colson, compliant, and flex.

tools.name: Battery Beak
tools.description: A battery beak determines the overall health of a robot battery.  The optimal percentage is around 120-130%.

tools.name: Clamp
tools.description: Clamps are used to keep objects from falling and to hold them in place while being worked on.

tools.name: File
tools.description: Metal files are used to trim/smoothen the rough edges of stock or other metal after being cut.
tools.found: Autoshop - Robot Cart; Woodshop - Back Cabinet

tools.name: Hand Drill
tools.description: A drill is a tool primarily used for making round holes or driving fasteners into stock. Drill bits/screw bits are put inside the drill gun, which change the size of the hole drilled.

tools.name: Pliers
tools.description: Pliers are used to hold objects firmly. They come in many different types of shapes.

tools.name: Ratchet
tools.description: A ratchet allows continuous motion in only one direction while preventing movement in the opposite direction.  It is used to fasten nuts to bolts.  The widths are designated by the following colors in our naming system to match the bolts: Red, Yellow, Orange.

tools.name: Rivet Gun
tools.description: A rivet gun is used to 'pop' the rivets (a fastener) to the holes in stock.

tools.name: Scratch All
tools.description: Scratch All is used to make dents/marks in stock so it’s easier to know where to drill.

tools.name: Square
tools.description: A square is like a ruler, but is shaped as a 90° angle for square measurements.

tools.name: Allen Key/T-Handles
tools.description: Holds a bolt in place while another person fastens the nut with a wrench or ratchet (or vice versa).  The widths are designated by the following colors in our naming system to match the bolts: Red, Yellow, Orange.

tools.name: Wire Strippers
tools.description: Wire strippers strip off the rubber tubing of the wire to expose the metal wire.

tools.name: Wrench
tools.description: A wrench is a tool used to provide grip to fasten nuts to bolts.  The widths are designated by the following colors in our naming system to match the bolts: Red, Yellow, Orange.
